data.title: Vandervelde Emile Kerr Charles
data.meta_description: Collectivism and Industrial Evolution / by Emile Vandervelde ; Translated by Charles H. Kerr by Vandervelde, Emile (1866-1938). Kerr, Charles H. (1860-) and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
First Edition. Near fine copy in the original gilt-blocked cloth. Slightest suggestion only of dust-dulling to the spine bands and panel edges. Remains particularly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, clean and strong. ; 245 pages; Physical desc. : xvi, 245 p ; 19 cm. Subject: Socialism --Subject: Social sciences --Communism, Socialism and Anarchism. Series: The Socialist Library ; V. 1 Kg.

First Edition. Near fine copy in the original gilt-blocked cloth. Slightest suggestion only of dust-dulling to the spine bands and panel edges. Remains particularly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, clean and strong. ; 245 pages; Physical desc. : xvi, 245 p ; 19 cm. Gebunden. Condition: New. KlappentextThis work has been selected by scholars as being culturally important, and is part of the knowledge base of civilization as we know it. This work was reproduced from the original artifact, and remains as true to the original w.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. 1st Edition. First American edition. Very uncommon as such. Decorative boards with stamped designs and red lettering. Frontis portrait of the author. Boards with wear to the edges and soiling; spine edges frayed; pages dusty. Emile Vandervelde (1866 ? 1938) was a Belgian statesman and a prominent figure in European socialism, who served in Belgian coalition governments from 1914 to 1937 and was influential in the peace negotiations following World War I.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. First Edition in English. 12mo. Pp. 229. Dark red cloth, titles stamped in black on the spine, blind stamped borders on the covers. Spine ends rubbed and very light spots to covers, head edge dust soiled, leaves crisp and bright, binding tight. "My thesis, in substance, is that we should guard against confusing Socialism with Statism." Vandervelde (1866-1938) was a leader in the Belgian Labor Party and deeply involved in international socialism.Founded in 1866, the Kerr Co. continues publishing in the field of radical politics.A scarce title in the original edition.
